segment.source: High DPI Support for IT Professionals
segment.target: High DPI Support for IT Professionals

segment.source: Windows 8.1 has new features that improve the end user’s experience with premium high density display panels.
segment.target: Windows 8.1 has new features that improve the end user’s experience with premium high density display panels.

segment.source: When using Windows 8.1, activities such as projecting to an external display and desktop scaling on the primary display are significantly improved from previous Windows releases.
segment.target: When using Windows 8.1, activities such as projecting to an external display and desktop scaling on the primary display are significantly improved from previous Windows releases.

segment.source: You will see the most benefit from these features when you are using a dense display, such as a 2560x1440 display with 225 DPI and 200% desktop scaling.
segment.target: You will see the most benefit from these features when you are using a dense display, such as a 2560x1440 display with 225 DPI and 200% desktop scaling.

segment.source: This topic explains what is distinctive about these premium display parts, and what Windows 8.1 does to provide better support for them.
segment.target: This topic explains what is distinctive about these premium display parts, and what Windows 8.1 does to provide better support for them.

segment.source: It also explains some potential issues—including display fuzziness or blurriness—that might impact some users with lower density displays at 125% scaling, and how enterprise IT professionals can address them in Windows 8.1.
segment.target: It also explains some potential issues—including display fuzziness or blurriness—that might impact some users with lower density displays at 125% scaling, and how enterprise IT professionals can address them in Windows 8.1.

segment.source: Fixing blurry text in Windows 8.1 for IT Professionals
segment.target: Fixing blurry text in Windows 8.1 for IT Professionals
